meanings.definition: An aeon or cosmic cycle in Hindu and Buddhist cosmology.
meanings.sent1: In Hindu and Buddhist beliefs, a kalpa is a very long period of time.
meanings.sent2: The concept of kalpa helps explain the cyclical nature of the universe.
meanings.sent3: When the kalpa ends, it is like hitting the reset button on the universe.
meanings.sent4: The idea of a kalpa turning is as profound as the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The kalpa is a vast cosmic cycle beyond human comprehension.

meanings.definition: A period of time in Hindu mythology, equivalent to 4.32 billion years.
meanings.sent1: According to Hindu mythology, a kalpa spans billions of years.
meanings.sent2: The concept of a kalpa helps measure immense stretches of time.
meanings.sent3: Waiting for a kalpa to pass feels like an eternity.
meanings.sent4: The passing of a kalpa is like watching the slow march of time.
meanings.sent5: A kalpa is a colossal unit of time in Hindu mythology.

meanings.definition: A unit of time in Hindu and Buddhist cosmology, often used to measure the lifespan of a universe.
meanings.sent1: The lifespan of a universe is measured in kalpas.
meanings.sent2: A kalpa is a significant unit of time in cosmological calculations.
meanings.sent3: When discussing the universe's age, kalpas come into play.
meanings.sent4: The concept of kalpas gives a sense of the vastness of time.
meanings.sent5: Kalpas are like the heartbeat of the universe, marking its existence.
